topic.title: Alerts
topic.abstract: Provide contextual feedback messages for typical user actions with the handful of available and flexible alert messages.

section.title: Example
section.p: Alerts are available for any length of text, as well as an optional close button. For proper styling, use one of the eight required contextual classes (e.g., .alert-success).

section.title: Additional content
section.p: Alerts can also contain additional HTML elements like headings, paragraphs and links.

section.title: Well done!
section.p: Aww yeah, you successfully read this important alert message. This example text with a link is going to run a bit longer so that you can see how spacing within an alert works with this kind of content.
Whenever you need to, be sure to use margin utilities to keep things nice and tidy.
